verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of the Preacher, <S%H6953><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of David, <S%H1732><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> in Jerusalem: <S%H3389><s%>
"Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities, <S%H1892><s%>" says <S%H559><s%> the Preacher; <S%H6953><s%> "Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities, <S%H1892><s%> all is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>"
What does man <S%H120><s%> gain <S%H3504><s%> from all his labor <S%H5999><s%> in which he labors <S%H5998><s%> under the sun? <S%H8121><s%>
One generation <S%H1755><s%> goes, <S%H1980><s%> and another generation <S%H1755><s%> comes; <S%H935><s%> but the earth <S%H776><s%> remains <S%H5975><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>
The sun <S%H8121><s%> also rises, <S%H2224><s%> and the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes down, <S%H935><s%> and hurries <S%H7602><s%> to its place <S%H4725><s%> where it rises. <S%H2224><s%>

The wind <S%H7307><s%> goes <S%H1980><s%> toward the south, <S%H1864><s%> and turns around <S%H5437><s%> to the north. <S%H6828><s%> It turns around <S%H5437><s%> continually <S%H1980><s%> as it goes, <S%H7307><s%> and the wind returns again to its courses. <S%H7725><s%>

All the rivers <S%H5158><s%> run <S%H1980><s%> into the sea, <S%H3220><s%> yet the sea <S%H3220><s%> is not full. <S%H4392><s%> To the place <S%H4725><s%> where the rivers <S%H5158><s%> flow, <S%H1980><s%> there they flow <S%H7725><s%> again. <S%H3212><s%>

All things <S%H1697><s%> are full of weariness <S%H3023><s%> <S%H376><s%> beyond <S%H3201><s%> uttering. <S%H1696><s%> The eye <S%H5869><s%> is not satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with seeing, <S%H7200><s%> nor the ear <S%H241><s%> filled <S%H7646><s%> with hearing. <S%H8085><s%>
That which has been is that which shall be; <S%H6213><s%> and that which has been done is that which shall be done: <S%H6213><s%> and there is no new <S%H2319><s%> thing under the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Is there <S%H3426><s%> a thing <S%H1697><s%> of which it may be said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H7200><s%> this is new? <S%H2319><s%>" It has been long ago, <S%H3528><s%> in the ages <S%H5769><s%> which were before us. <S%H6440><s%>

There is no memory <S%H2146><s%> of the former; <S%H7223><s%> neither shall there be any memory <S%H2146><s%> of the latter that are to come, <S%H314><s%> among those that shall come after. <S%H314><s%>
I, <S%H6953><s%> the Preacher, was king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

I applied <S%H5414><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to seek <S%H1875><s%> and to search out <S%H8446><s%> by wisdom <S%H2451><s%> concerning all that is done <S%H6213><s%> under the sky. <S%H8064><s%> It is a heavy <S%H7451><s%> burden <S%H6045><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> to be afflicted with. <S%H6031><s%>

I have seen <S%H7200><s%> all the works <S%H4639><s%> that are done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun; <S%H8121><s%> and behold, <S%H1892><s%> all is vanity and a chasing <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
That which is crooked <S%H5791><s%> can't <S%H3201><s%> be made straight; <S%H8626><s%> and that which is lacking <S%H2642><s%> can't <S%H3201><s%> be counted. <S%H4487><s%>

I said <S%H1696><s%> to myself, <S%H3820><s%> "Behold, <S%H559><s%> I have obtained <S%H3254><s%> for myself great <S%H1431><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> above all who were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> Yes, <S%H3820><s%> my heart has had great <S%H7235><s%> experience <S%H7200><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>"

I applied <S%H5414><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and to know <S%H3045><s%> madness <S%H1947><s%> and folly. <S%H5531><s%> I perceived <S%H3045><s%> that this <S%H1571><s%> also was a chasing <S%H7475><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
For in much <S%H7230><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is much <S%H7230><s%> grief; <S%H3708><s%> and he who increases <S%H3254><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%> increases <S%H3254><s%> sorrow. <S%H4341><s%>
